intro: Oldenlandia succosa, commonly known as the succulent spiderwort, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and clusters of small, star-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in partial shade to full sun. Its adaptability makes it a common weed in many regions. The species belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants.
